column2: ALASKA DMV PERMIT TEST
column4: Alaska
column6: AK

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. If you hear a thumping sound while driving, you should:
column4: pull the steering wheel back.
column6: try your emergency lights.
column8: get off the road and check your tires.
column10: hook your shoe under the gas pedal and see if you can free it.

column2: 2. This sign warns that:
column4: the bridge ahead is wide enough for only one vehicle at a time.
column6: traffic must merge left.
column8: traffic must merge right.

column2: 3. This road sign means:
column4: Two-way Traffic
column6: No Turning
column8: Low clearance

column2: 4. A steady green light at intersections means:
column4: You may not turn right
column6: You may drive through the intersection if the road is clear
column8: You must stop and check for oncoming traffic before proceeding

column2: 5. This sign tells drivers that:
column4: left and right turns are not allowed.
column6: a divided highway is ahead.
column8: they must stop at the next intersection.

column2: 6. When backing up your vehicle you should:
column4: turn to the right to look out the rear window.
column6: check the left mirror, then back up slowly.
column8: sound your horn so others know that you are about to back up.

column2: 7. Two solid yellow lines on the pavement mean:
column4: passing is not allowed.
column6: passing is allowed during daylight only.
column8: passing is allowed for both drivers.
column10: passing is allowed if you are at the top of a hill.

column2: 8. Excluding business districts, alleys, residential areas and school zones, the speed limit on Alaskan roadways is ______ unless otherwise posted.
column4: 55 MPH
column6: 45 MPH
column8: 50 MPH

column2: 9. If you accumulate ___ or more points in a period of 12 months, your license will be suspended.
10. Which shape is a warning sign?
column4: Pennant
column6: Triangle
column8: Round

column2: 11. This sign means:
column4: Take route 45 if you are driving at night.
column6: The night-time speed limit is 45 MPH.
column8: The recommended speed limit is 45 MPH.
column10: The minimum speed limit is 45 MPH.

column2: 12. One of the penalties for Driving Under the Influence (DUI) is license suspension for not less than:
column4: six months.
column6: 90 days.
column8: 60 days.

column2: 13. When they see this sign, drivers should:
column4: slow down and keep well to the right.
column6: slow down and keep well to the left.
column8: not turn right.
column10: increase their speed and keep well to the right.

column2: 14. What does this road sign indicate?
column4: Motor vehicles entering an exclusive right-turn lane must weave across bicycle traffic in bicycle lanes.
column6: Vehicles turning left must yield to bikes entering a right turn lane.
column8: Drivers have the right of way over bikes turning left.

column2: 15. This road sign means:
column4: A road joins from the left
column6: The road ahead turns sharply right then sharply left
column8: Sharp right turn

column2: 16. Which of the following is true about the Anti-Locking Brake System?
column4: It prevents skidding.
column6: It allows drivers to steer during an emergency braking situation.
column8: Can help improve vehicle stability.

column2: 17. What should drivers do when they see this road sign?
column4: slow down, look for a train, and be prepared to stop.
column6: come to a complete stop and wait for a train to cross.
column8: increase their speed to cross the intersection before a train arrives.

column2: 18. When are you allowed to drink alcoholic beverages in a vehicle on a public highway?
column4: As long as you donâ€™t drive.
column6: Only if you ride in the back seat.
column8: Only if you ride in the back of a pick-up truck.

column2: 19. This road sign:
column4: warns drivers of a sharp turn left. Drivers should slow their speed and keep to the left.
column6: provides an advance notice of a roundabout.
column8: warns drivers that U-turns are not permitted.

column2: 20. This sign means:
column4: Drivers will soon be on a roadway with two-way traffic.
column6: Divided highway ahead.
column8: Keep to the left.
